layer.name: Sacrifice
layer.definition: Pour out for others with no expectation of return.

questions.text: Freely sharing knowledge I could charge for (teaching, mentoring without payment) is ...

answers.4: common — I teach and mentor generously
answers.5: automatic — knowledge is meant to be given
answers.2: occasional — for people who've earned it
answers.3: moderate — I share some things freely

questions.text: Creating resources that benefit others without requiring anything in return is ...

answers.4: common — I regularly create for others' benefit
answers.5: central — my intellectual output is for giving away
answers.2: occasional — sometimes I share what I make
answers.3: moderate — I've created some free resources
answers.1: rare — I create for my own purposes

questions.text: Investing serious intellectual effort in others' problems (not just quick advice) is ...
questions.principle: Deep help costs time and thought

answers.4: common — I engage deeply with others' problems
answers.5: normal — others' problems get my best thinking
answers.3: moderate — I invest real effort sometimes

questions.text: Training others who may surpass or compete with me is ...

answers.4: welcome — I want them to grow
answers.5: the goal — their growth is my success

questions.text: Having given significant intellectual help that was never thanked or used (without regret) is ...

answers.4: part of giving — I keep investing anyway
answers.5: expected — the gift is in the giving
answers.3: real — but it's made me selective
answers.1: not my experience — I invest where there's return
